page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: The{farming}in our "D" block is typical{East-Anglian}farming.Nearly all the farms in our area are{arable .A few keep cows and sheep. The land around all of East-Anglia is very flat and fertile,just right for arable farming.The farmers grow barley,wheat and broad bean etc.There are a few farmers who grow oil-seed rape,peas and sugar-beet.There are also some fields growing grass for hay.The farms in our area vary a lot. Nunn's Farm has 13 fields which total 223 acres. Howe Hall is not owned by one farmer,it is owned by a few and they formed a partnership working on the farm.It has 35 fields and 650 acres. Elmdon Lee was built in the 17th centuary.The barn is 300 years old.
